abrogate verb [T]
(avoid responsibility)
to avoid something that you should do: Companies are really abrogating responsibility for safety. He seemed to abrogate his duty to withhold law and order.
More examplesFewer examplesThose in power abrogated their responsibility.The government is abrogating its duty to protect the safety of its citizens.Some parents completely abrogate responsibility for parenting to schools.
